lexUnit.name: fragility.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the quality or state of being fragile

sentence.text: Young Vietnamese women seemed to have a fragility that foreigners found irresistible .
Thus the diversified structure had its own in-built fragility .
The extreme fragility of the original volume means that the present version will be of considerable use to scholars and researchers .

Quite apart from the conceptual fragility of the enterprise , Kane' s work suffers from a problem of method : his evidence for the above assertions was collected from a sample of sportsmen who had already achieved a level of success , in other words the sportsmen he studied had ` made it " .
While this may be true , we should remember the fragility and plasticity of the human psyche .
Deforestation , overgrazing and shortened fallow periods threaten the fragility of Rwanda 's soils .
In March Mr Gorbachev himself remarked on this supposed fragility .

One of the serious problems with Kane 's work is that , despite its theoretical fragility , it is simple , comprehensive and , unfortunately , appealing ; it explains everything to do with blacks ' sporting success as rooted in race .

It admits , however , that the big risk is of a lower figure -- especially if asset-price deflation and financial fragility continue to restrain demand , and if the Uruguay round of trade talks collapses .
The pale yellow skirt and sleeveless top she wore seemed , somehow , to emphasise her fragility .
The rush into speculative bid candidates was seen by some observers as further evidence of the fragility of the market .
Coupled with this has been the inevitable problem of glass fragility .
On the other hand its comparative fragility makes the risk of solicitation of clients by a former employee the more serious .
The fragility of the parliamentary system was already apparent .
They distracted James briefly : her wrists were so tiny they made him think for an instant of the impossible fragility of robins ' legs .
The young French artist 's sculptures have a seeming fragility .
The girl in the photograph had a fair fragility , altogether too vulnerable .
She ponders her body 's fragility , her intellectual struggles , the poverty and drabness of her environment , and her need for friendship ; the poem ends with thoughts of the world to come .
The affair highlighted the fragility of Endara 's government and the extent to which it remained dependent on the presence of nearly 10,000 US troops .
